Data types are defined in XML with derived types indicated by XBRL in the Data Type Registry. A taxonomy may employ several DTR references and contain custom data types.

c512b5297040273532850f3a0def0aba.term-definition: data type registry (DTR) - A registry of well-known well-defined data types based on standard XML types and expanded by XBRL specifications and taxonomies. See the XBRL Data Type Registry 1.x.

6fe5dbff74e15b3d4152cb4b68e27719.term-definition: debit - A value for the balance type property of a concept such that, in accounting, this concept represents a debit or a monetary amount owed or paid.

10ae4766bc8f47548684316e413426d0.term-definition: decimals - A number that has both a whole number and a fractional component. This is also the XML data type for representing fractional numbers.

b380aaa89147ba11485f9355c488f9f9.term-definition: decimals property - The specified precision with which consumers should process a numeric fact. See the XBRL Precision, Decimals and Units 1.0 specification for more information.

4206d2fb41cfd8350a7ddd6eb35c7dff.term-definition: default - An expected condition where none is specified.

67054e5ddd18784ab566d01da9452edf.term-definition: definition or definition relationship - A relationship that arranges pairs of concepts in a specific semantic relationship. These relationships may be above and beyond calculation or presentation relationships. Concept core dimensions cannot be used in a definition relationship.

e75041db1a090c95621291c35693051b.term-definition: definition linkbase - An optional XML file containing additional relationships between concepts.

77824bf73d730bffcb51d3e0a23e23ec.term-definition: dependent dimensions - Data dimensions whose values rely upon the values of another dimension. Dependent dimensions cannot establish uniqueness within a data set. XBRL inherently does not permit the use of dependent dimensions as taxonomy-defined dimensions.

5bcffd3f7d2a240550bac35336aca288.term-definition: deprecated date label - The label for a concept when the concept has been or will be deprecated.
5bcffd3f7d2a240550bac35336aca288.term-definition-lang: مسمى التاريخ الذي سوف يتم فيه إهمال استخدام المفهوم

e2555b3ddba33d58c51b3717d4b808a4.term-definition: deprecated label - A label to indicate a concept has been deprecated.
e2555b3ddba33d58c51b3717d4b808a4.term-definition-lang: مسمى يدل ان المفهوم قد تم اهمال استخدامه.

474706ae54b9f7c694f5d4c11f908a7d.term-definition: derived data type - An XML data type defined in XSD that is derived from the primitive data types. These data types can be built upon other data types by restrictions on the set of permitted values, by listing a sequence of values based on primitive types, or by unions of multiple primitive types.

930418803251903046ba22132f6dec98.term-definition: dimension - A data dimension is an axis intersecting or defining data points. XBRL constructs used to express data dimensionality are termed XBRL dimensions and are either core dimensions or taxonomy-defined dimensions.

7a2d697e7dfa08066f82e9b1bab1f221.term-definition: dimension-default - A definition relationship indicating a concept is the default value for a taxonomy-defined dimension.
7a2d697e7dfa08066f82e9b1bab1f221.term-definition-lang: علاقة تشير ان المفهوم يمثل القيمة المفترضة لبُعد

e55da22ff35abb4b5c07a762b1ec03fc.term-definition: dimension-domain - A definition relationship indicating a concept represents the domain of a taxonomy-defined dimension.

7cc657426c7505ac606660e6a7b081dd.term-definition: Discoverable Taxonomy Set - A set of all linkbase and schema documents referenced within a taxonomy. The Discoverable Taxonomy Set (DTS) allows taxonomy developers to define all documents and linkbases required for the taxonomy.

fdd862fb426ec1f54f6ac27f68a5465f.term-definition: documentation - A set of explanatory guides to aid readers in understanding and using an XBRL taxonomy. There can be numerous different types of documentation available to readers in either print or electronic form. Documentation needs vary by taxonomy size and complexity.

69717381c3a87423fa03c8eee33b8649.term-definition: documentation label -A longer, more descriptive label for a concept that usually provides a description of the concept's meaning and how it should be used

4ba2d191bd9ba5dd2501c7009ddc0f1e.term-definition: domain - A set of allowable values. In XBRL, a domain refers to an abstract concept that represents an entire set of other concepts for explicitly defined domains or whose data type represents the entire domain for the dimension (a typed domain). The domain and its members are used to classify facts along the axis. For example, "Arkansas" is a domain member in the domain "States" and would be used to classify elements such as revenues and assets in Arkansas as distinct from other states.

5aed0e3bbb4e6dc9940841f51b73a169.term-definition: domain-member - A definition relationship indicating one concept is a member of the domain of the other concept, which is part of a taxonomy-defined dimension.

d61db260b1f5687a40369905d41d89da.term-definition: draft taxonomy - A version of the taxonomy that has passed internal changes and validation and is now ready for public review. Given comments from the public review and how they are addressed, the taxonomy can either return to a candidate stage or be implemented as a release taxonomy.

3fe0ed88e146fa8da61cbff95706d631.term-definition: duration - A value for the period type property of a concept core dimension or a type of period core dimension that indicates the reported fact is relevant to a time period. If a concept core dimension's period type is duration, that concept must intersect with a duration-type period core dimension.

a1d2345d63ea81efcbfe3535da57b7bf.term-definition: element - A specific tag in XML. For XML based XBRL instance data, the element name with its associated namespace represents the concept core dimension applied to the contained fact data. For XBRL in XML and Inline XBRL, the terms element and concept are used interchangeably.

45761974b9bc62d136ced87a500e9bac.term-definition: element nesting - The act of containing one or more elements within an element. XSD specifies which elements can be nested and how.

c59122dc3652bb32a8a3b1f39d92b5e9.term-definition: encoding - Encoding is the method of representing characters and character positions. The simplest encoding mode is ASCII (96 printable US-EN characters). Unicode represents more than 65 thousand character. Unicode Transformation Format (UTF) allows Unicode to be represented in an 8-bit wide channel or data store. XML, by default uses UTF encoding, but some systems are limited to accepting only ASCII. In HTML and XML, extended characters can also be represented as character entities for example, † is a Unicode dagger "†".

fe65944f25320381df4d9bcd411c7cd9.term-definition: entity - A business, department, school, group, or individual functioning as a data reporter. Generally, entities have some specific identifier, such as a tax number, LEI, or CIK number, that can be used in an XBRL report with the entity core dimension. Entity identifiers are required when combining instance data for comparison to separate reporters. Note that a reporting entity may not be the report preparer.

2a842ef7ac2ce075fbc94d073bfdd7cc.term-definition: entity core dimension - A required XBRL dimension that identifies the entity.

06f29d5f85cecc55c0aef3870c2e6604.term-definition: entity-specific reporting or entity-specific disclosure - A reporting situation where preparers can create or use their own methods of representing their data. Entity-specific reporting requires an open reporting system and extensibility. It can also lead to less comparable XBRL reports.

7c8f8951a8e3421b360a165936499b8a.term-definition: entry point - A specific top-level default presentation or subset within a taxonomy. Taxonomies will often provide multiple entry points for different reporting purposes and use cases. There should be an entry point to define an entire taxonomy.

1ba6587f6f0d69676f289c77aa59cba5.term-definition: enumeration - A complete, ordered list of all items within a set. In XBRL, enumerations can often be found in relation to data types.

fdf23f0868a43715986ca61ceb22e976.term-definition: essence-alias - A definition relationship indicating one concept of a pair essentially has the same meaning as the other concept.
fdf23f0868a43715986ca61ceb22e976.term-definition-lang: علاقة تعريفية بين مفهومان لهم واحد منهم له نفس المعنى الاساسي للأخر

3f0bfa405bfb13e3a5709a953fbb7ba6.term-definition: explicit taxonomy-defined dimension - A taxonomy-defined dimension whose domain of allowable values is explicitly enumerated within the taxonomy. Explicit taxonomy-defined dimensions have member concepts that represent allowable values for a domain. If extensibility is allowed, preparers may be able to add further domain member concepts.
3f0bfa405bfb13e3a5709a953fbb7ba6.term-name-lang: بُعد محدد الاعضاء معرف في المفردات

5ceb89915cf9e68b856bf6a76d9050bc.term-definition: extended link - A link type in XLink that provides for multiple resources at the source or destination to be connected via multiple arcs. The origin resource and the destination resource are defined by labels.

67d918b77230a12f9686c244c3c542ca.term-definition: extensibility - The ability of a reporting system to allow additional XBRL constructs beyond those defined in its taxonomy. For an open, extensible reporting system, this can involve extension labels, footnotes, concepts, dimensions, presentations, data types, or even incorporating entire extension taxonomies. Extensibility can increase user flexibility but decrease comparability among XBRL reports.

46a5637ff578d182edc2ad56c7b2ecf2.term-definition: extension or extension taxonomy - A published, existing set of concepts which another taxonomy can include. In an open reporting system, preparers can define their own concepts to extend one or more existing taxonomies. An extension taxonomy will have a unique namespace separating the concept names from the base taxonomy.

ca66c81a29a9bcbb7cc248323e591c1e.term-definition: fact - A unique and discrete piece of information within an XBRL report as defined by the intersection of various XBRL dimensions. When all dimensions are defined correctly, a fact will not only be unique within the report but also globally amongst all data. The content of fact is dictated by the data type of its concept core dimension.

18d2e6b73ca925ef0d7a7dae5ca1046c.term-definition: factset - The result of the execution of a XULE statement. A factset contains all the facts from and XBRL report that meet the criteria stipulated in the statement.

62cc32da165372431f70ae47761ed6d2.term-definition: factset filtering - The act of using XULE statement(s) to filter the facts of an XBRL report per specific conditions.

e0736d48b0af70dae511777dae7f6bdb.term-definition: fixed or floating point - A description of arithmetic approaches to representing fractional numbers in terms of bits while balancing range and precision. For XBRL, numeric values are defined by the concept core dimension's data type, as well as the precision and decimals properties of the fact. See decimals and precision.
e0736d48b0af70dae511777dae7f6bdb.term-name-lang: اماكن عشرية محددة او غير محددة العدد

37b09c10a74aba98f870d6b6215f8dc3.term-definition: footnote or note - A footnote is used to add additional explanatory information to one or more facts. A footnote is added to a fact through the note core ID dimension. Note that footnotes and the note core ID dimension can add the same context to multiple facts and therefore cannot confer uniqueness.

a0bbe941a09cc4937e36f95f9ec9aef4.term-definition: formula - A mathematical relationship between two or more concepts. Note formulas are separate from calculations and can represent more complicated relationships.

59819c05da3ba64da9fb96b78e2a1871.term-definition: formula linkbase - An optional XML file containing the formula relationships between concepts provided with an instance.

a1c5a39ba10d87b51492ce639e1be863.term-definition: functional requirement - A specification of operations of a system or its components as a furtherance of what that system is meant to accomplish. Functional requirements may involve technical details, data manipulation and processing, calculations, and data modeling.

f66cad2551b9e8a845cf935ad59234f6.term-definition: general-special - A definition relationship indicating one concept of a pair is a more specialized form of the other concept.
f66cad2551b9e8a845cf935ad59234f6.term-definition-lang: علاقة تعريفية بين مفهومان تدل ان احد المفهمان متخصص والاخر عمومي.

1497635976d3ed4e07e9640fab010727.term-definition: governance - The act of overseeing the creation, testing, implementation, support, and maintenance of a taxonomy or a structured reporting environment. A governance system sees a taxonomy through its lifecycle and may be comprised of one or more taxonomy working groups and committees.

68ecfcc5332127243a5166917eb85f2e.term-definition: hierarchy - A structuring of data such that items are ranked in relation to other items. A position within a hierarchy is considered a node, and the highest node (to which all other nodes are subordinate) is considered the root. Hierarchies make use of parent/child and sibling relationships between and among nodes. In XBRL, hierarchies are comprised of concept trees (presentation, calculation, and so forth) and are used to express and navigate concept relationships.

4291089bd79921b3bd1e2a26d6672f38.term-definition: human-readability - The ability of humans to read and digest information presented in a report. Aside from reports submitted in Inline XBRL, XBRL reports are generally not considered human-readable.

4f4c23939acb443c5f374e19bedd4179.term-definition: hypercube - A multi-dimensional structure (cube) having more than three data planes. Most XBRL facts involve a hypercube structure.

ad755870dcdb4892109277a4d58e2a6b.term-definition: identifier - A set of characters or digits that serves to uniquely identify an entity. Examples of identifiers include legal entity identifiers, social security numbers, central key index numbers, and tax ID numbers. Developers should use care in selecting identifiers that are publicly known.

b9d5f13b9387edcabd2a2424f2eae9dc.term-definition: implementation phase - The stage of the taxonomy lifecycle during which the taxonomy is implemented in the reporting environment.

f468b88d03214326bc514108593b5e3e.term-definition: imputed value - A value that is not specifically provided but could be calculated based on other provided numbers and calculation weights.

6b5032c9be648ddcd990142696953e02.term-definition: information supply chain - A system of organizations, people, activities, and resources involved in moving data from preparers to consumers. In this document, the supply chain refers specifically to data moving from the preparer's business data model to a consumer's model via the transport model (or the XBRL taxonomy).

70982654fa9a51276a98ae8478dd3cc2.term-definition: independent dimensions - Data dimensions whose values so not rely upon the values of another dimension. Independent dimensions within a data set are often said to be orthogonal to one another.

410832ebfbdf95e23ce1b4d6d827c1b8.term-definition: inheritance - The act of assuming the properties or characteristics of a parent item or element. Hierarchical relationships in XBRL do not imply inheritance.
410832ebfbdf95e23ce1b4d6d827c1b8.term-definition-lang: هو نقل الخصائص من عنصر أصيل إلى عنصر مستحدث. العلاقة الهرمية في XBRL لا تشير إلى ميراث خصائص.

36875758ca1923424bf5dc64248ad7cf.term-definition: Inline XBRL - An XBRL transport format that embeds XBRL tagging directly into an XHTML document. This produces a single human-readable and machine-readable document.
36875758ca1923424bf5dc64248ad7cf.term-definition-lang: صيغة من صيغ XBRL لنقل البيانات تضمن علامات XBRL مباشرة في ملف. وذلك ينتج ملف واحد يمكن قرائته عن طريق الحاسب الألي والبشر في نفس الوقت. XHTML

6fcb7bb4589b53a81014f751fb181bdb.term-definition: instant - A value for the period type property of a concept core dimension or a type of period core dimension that indicates the reported fact is relevant to a particular point in time. If a concept core dimension's period type is instant, that concept must intersect with an instant-type period core dimension

05261d85b4a85e00a284153731813155.term-definition: intellectual property agreement - A legal document specifying that ideas and work contributed to a project has been freely provided and not eligible for a creative property claim.

929563f40a046ec7ca15bf37ef73f7a6.term-definition: integer - A data type indicating that the fact is stated in whole numbers.

8e93b3a0f9968ff7969796b921ce26bf.term-definition: javascript object notation (JSON) - A text format that provides for the expression of complex structured data through parameter:value pairs. A number of programming languages will natively create and read JSON.
8e93b3a0f9968ff7969796b921ce26bf.term-definition-lang: صيغة نصية للتعبير عن بيانات مهيكلة معقدة عن طريق ازواج من مفتاح:قيمة. الكثير من لغات البرمجة تسطيع إنتاج وقراءة هذه النوعية من الملفات.
8e93b3a0f9968ff7969796b921ce26bf.translation-notes: نوع ملف لتخزين بيانات لها هيكل معقد

36be92f1345adf417b5a59b125754656.term-definition: key - A set of values in a combination of data dimensions that serves to uniquely identify a data point.
36be92f1345adf417b5a59b125754656.term-definition-lang: مجموعة من القييم مع ابعاد تمكن من تحديد نقطة بيانات بشكل منفرد.
36be92f1345adf417b5a59b125754656.translation-notes: كود غير متكرر لتعريف بيان معين.

5942ce1ed1392173f4e2c872676bfb25.term-definition: label - A human-readable name for a concept. Each concept has a standard label that corresponds to the concept name and is unique across the taxonomy. Other labels can also be applied.

aed0020817594a0b071c1638d9e81c94.term-definition: label linkbase - An optional XML file containing information to associate labels to concepts.

5ff30f230c820b609df4ed2b7862dd4d.term-definition: label role - A distinguishing name for each distinct concept indicating the circumstances in which it should be used. Each concept may be given a separate defining label role to use in different presentation situations.

8b028e398d05ecbc9ffca8824fd8e130.term-definition: language core dimension - An optional XBRL dimension that identifies the language of a textual fact.

0d4caa3ce9f7c2e861f8ab406c62da35.term-definition: lifecycle - The stages of taxonomy development, validation, implementation, and maintenance. The size and complexity of the taxonomy and the reporting requirements should dictate the level of governance required to oversee the taxonomy lifecycle.

3383706d76f1a22e7ad74571ec41c309.term-definition: line item - An element that conventionally appears on the vertical axis (rows) of a table.

c46c84801ae2c49006cd934b59313bdf.term-definition: linkbase - An XML file containing information that defines relationships among the concepts of an XBRL taxonomy. Linkbase files end with a ".xml" file extension. Some types of linkbase files are optional.

728575464c64e4ae29acaf114afce27e.term-definition: logical data model - A model that defines the data points in the conceptual data model and how they relate to each other and other data constructs.

3d903394808408eeeac12d42d2d4e206.term-definition: machine-readability - The ability of computers to read and parse information presented in a report. XBRL reports are formatted in a structured, pre-determined manner and are thus designed to be machine-readable.

6ee79f4c5c883257544d97a4fbe23689.term-definition: many-to-many relationship - A data dimension where many data points are related to many other data points.

dfe9b019d717ff488444215a61c41111.term-definition: markup - The machine-readable code that is meant to be processed by the XML parser. Markup instructs the XML parser on how to process the XML document's content.

68bec69640437b6c0abeb13ac2cf10ea.term-definition: member - A concept that belongs to an explicit taxonomy-defined dimension as a possible value within a domain of values.

d6c885e2b4312e59a15988495056db2f.term-definition: minimum data set - The amount of data necessary to meet all the use cases, requirements, and regulations involved in a taxonomy without including redundant or extraneous information.

5bff4222895b049a2a69b331244f9a87.term-definition: namespace - A Universal Resource Identifier (URI) identifying the organization that maintains the concept definitions. Namespaces are used to identify specific taxonomy components that make up an entire set of data. Namespaces are usually shortened a namespace prefix, which then becomes part of a qualified name (qname). Many prefix names are conventionally used, such as "ix" for Inline XBRL or "us-gaap" for the US GAAP taxonomy. Namespaces are used both within XML as part of the element name and also as part of XBRL to identify taxonomies.
5bff4222895b049a2a69b331244f9a87.translation-notes: اسلوب يستخدم في البرمجة لتجميع الاسماء ذات العلاقة في نطاق اسم واحد وتفادي الخلط بين الاسماء المكرر.

a598849a1ff053f84f12082f9b7cd369.term-definition: negated label - A label type that causes numeric values of a concept to be displayed with their sign flipped.

b653db43d0ba61b4c5f5e614335b42ac.term-definition: negative label - A label to indicate a concept's fact value must be reported and interpreted as a negative value.

4b0f5b7a22b465011cba9e75af2970dd.term-definition: net label - A label to indicate a concept is presented as a net of a set of fact values associated with other concepts.

a3b2c62f774bb99a31052c3f768e12db.term-definition: nillable - A concept property that indicates if the fact intersecting with that concept can be empty (nil or not reported). If the nillable property is "false", the fact must have a non-empty value. XBRL taxonomy tools normally have the default value for nillable as "true". Note that nil is not synonymous with a value of zero.

aef1e57606d5a370eecffbb26e518094.term-definition: node - A position in a hierarchy.

b1ed508319b561fb5c253570267e4276.term-definition: non-functional requirement - A requirement that imposes a constraint on the system's design or implementation, quite often for quality or ease-of-use purposes. Non-functional requirements may be posed as requests/recommendations and must be weighed carefully in terms of their cost versus their benefit and their impact on the overall taxonomy.

a87a02e1e443ea085975eb99ecec3126.term-definition: non-numeric data - Data that is not quantifiable. In XBRL, non-numeric data is quite commonly text. Non-numeric data cannot be used in mathematical operations.

7015e032f7111d624c67c9200d9f2a6f.term-definition: non-relational data - A data set that has no semantic relationships among its data points.

9c05d069a57e9fe277605995edb6f661.term-definition: note core ID dimension - An optional XBRL dimension that links one or more XBRL facts to footnote data through a unique ID number specific to that footnote or set of footnotes.
9c05d069a57e9fe277605995edb6f661.translation-notes: المُعرف لملاحظة هامشية وهو بُعد جوهري

f96baafbfe5058a28e45bf3e6239b547.term-definition: numeric data - Data that is quantifiable, measurable, and can be expressed with solely numerals. Numeric data can be used in mathematical operations.

9f895c85c1d32400a39137be17c402e3.term-definition: one-to-many relationship - A data dimension where one data point is related to many other data points.

c4323377b055f664391487702ebb5bb4.term-definition: one-to-one relationship - A data dimension where one data point is related to one other data point.

63ded6f3b65435cc6939ce4be46e55ef.term-definition: ontology - A set of concepts in a subject area or domain showing the properties of those concepts and the relationships between them. An ontology is commonly referred to as a taxonomy.
63ded6f3b65435cc6939ce4be46e55ef.term-definition-lang: مجموعة من المفاهيم في مجال توضح خصائص تلك المفاهيم والعلاقة فيما بينها. يشار إليها بالتصنيف.

d0ade6c5cbbc3ef2993a140a29e97619.term-definition: open property - A property of a hypercube that specifies that any of the taxonomy-defined dimensions in the hypercube can intersect on a fact in order for that fact to be part of the hypercube.
d0ade6c5cbbc3ef2993a140a29e97619.term-definition-lang: سمة - open لمكعب متعدد الأبعاد تحدد ان اي بُعد من الابعاد المُعرفة في التصنيفات يمكن ان يتقاطع مع حقيقة لتصبح الحقيقة جزء من هذا المكعب.

1ad15e803f22f4c7bbdc268f0511357d.term-name: open reporting or open reporting system
1ad15e803f22f4c7bbdc268f0511357d.term-definition: open reporting or open reporting system - A reporting system that allows its XBRL taxonomy to be extended or customized. An open reporting system permits entity-specific reporting.
1ad15e803f22f4c7bbdc268f0511357d.term-definition-lang: نظام يسمح بالضافة إلي مفردات XBRL المعمول بها او تعديله. يسمح النظام بتقاربر خاصة بالمؤسسة.

056e66a8cefdd015fb9e075a728aa2a5.term-definition: parent relationship - A hierarchical node (concept) that has one or more child node(s). Note that in XBRL parent/child relationships have no implied or explicit inheritance.

5ccc89c365030d457be4165e68b2d652.term-definition: parent/child relationship - A relationship between concepts that indicates subordination of one concept to the other in a hierarchy. Linkbase files often use parent/child hierarchies to model several different relationships, including presentations, calculations, and membership of concepts within a domain used as the axis of a table. Note there is no inheritance of values or properties implied by the parent/child relationship in XBRL.

5e4b57b5b29a1021c41b295f9a941b3c.term-definition: period core dimension - A required XBRL dimension that identifies the time period relevant to a fact. A period core dimension can either be instant or duration.

b4d4747359267ab6d750ad48f77329da.term-definition: period end label - A label to indicate a concept represents the end of a period value.

becb8e23676881e57996f8ee614b9b9f.term-definition: period start label - A label to indicate a concept represents the beginning of a period value.

3ddda68746a66f350130ecfa3d584c30.term-definition: period type - A property of a concept that reflects whether it is reported for an instant or duration time period. The period type indicates the type of period core dimension (instant or duration) with which the concept core dimension may intersect.

dc1611a32658b027b1755fc12d21f0ba.term-definition: physical data model - A physical data model includes all the concepts of the taxonomy, including their properties, as well as the relationships among the concepts (as arcs or through an abstract hierarchical structure for example).
dc1611a32658b027b1755fc12d21f0ba.term-definition-lang: نموذج يحتوي على كل المفاهيم للمفردات، بما في ذلك الخصائص، والعلاقات بين المفاهيم (على شكل أقواس او من خلال عناصر هيكل هرمي مجرد على سبيل المثال).

30bf3f1273db80b59af6da994570d7e4.term-definition: pilot or candidate taxonomy - A version of a taxonomy set forth for testing and validation. Once the taxonomy has been validated to internal standards, the pilot or candidate version becomes a draft taxonomy set for public review.

2ae978876412233115e81710c4e6e4a9.term-definition: pilot phase - The stage of the taxonomy lifecycle during which the taxonomy is validated and opened to public review. Changes to the candidate and draft taxonomies should be incorporated before an official release.

5d554113f2f9fbedc85e35beac1ca16e.term-definition: positive label - A label to indicate a concept's fact value must be reported and interpreted as a positive value.

1b0ca96e478061ecfb668f64dc4f449e.term-definition: primitive data type - A data type defined in XML that serves as the basis for other data types. There are 19 primitive XML data types.
1b0ca96e478061ecfb668f64dc4f449e.term-definition-lang: نوع بيانات تم تعريفه في XML ويكون اساس لانواع أخرى من البيانات. يوجد 19 نوع بيانات اصيل في XML.

3b887cbf019043780718116955bbb905.term-definition: precision - The specified level of numeric precision with which a consumer should process a numeric fact. See the XBRL Precision, Decimals and Units 1.0 specification for more information.

10060d2a90db8920eea8328986e36766.term-definition: prefix or namespace prefix - A shorthand sequence of letters for a namespace (for example, "US GAAP" is a common prefix for the namespace http://xbrl.us/US GAAP/2008-01-31). The prefix precedes a concept name and indicates to which namespace that concept belongs. See namespace and qname.

053f948ba777f6ecb9fd777fe6cc7a53.term-definition: preparer - The party or parties that produce XBRL instance (and linkbase) data. Preparers can include, but are not limited to, companies, filing agents preparing XBRL reports on the behalf of others, and other industry reporters.

1e953542380b6e74f4e377206d4661b1.term-definition: Preparer Guide - A document detailing how to use the taxonomy to produce XBRL reports. The Preparer Guide should cover data preparation, transformation, validation, and dissemination as applicable. Supporting software systems should be documented as well.

16352b20acbfc2eb8f4e9e2a22b4a190.term-definition: presentation or presentation relationship - A relationship that arranges concepts in a hierarchy. Presentations often group concepts by semantic similarity or common use case.
16352b20acbfc2eb8f4e9e2a22b4a190.term-definition-lang: علاقة لترتيب المفاهيم بشكل هرمي. في العادة يقوم العرض بتويب المفاهيم بالدلالة او حالات الاستخدام المشتركة.

9b68f032e11340e88437c61ab1deb4ea.term-definition: presentation linkbase - An XML file containing information to link concepts together in a presentation structure. The presentation linkbase defines the organizational relationships of concepts using parent/child hierarchies.

465a1419699fd604445ce76959735113.term-definition: project scope - The work that must be done to deliver a product with a predetermined set of features and functions.

a5d562790858221df6030e688533c728.term-definition: public review - The opportunity for the public (which may vary given the size and impact of the taxonomy) to comment on and suggest changes for a candidate/pilot XBRL taxonomy. Public reviews generally last for a pre-determined amount of time before the suggestions are gathered, evaluated, and changes are made if warranted in a new draft taxonomy.

c7f5f28e085f7728e1412bdea0042be0.term-definition: qname - A qualified XML name with both a namespace prefix and the concept (element) name (for example, "ix:nonFraction" or "us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalents" are qualified names).
c7f5f28e085f7728e1412bdea0042be0.term-definition-lang: أسم يتكون من بادئ نطاق الاسم وأسم المفهوم (العنصر) على سبيل المثال "ix:nonFraction" أو "us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalents"

a1bf82d897e474bc7ad70f8d9ef6f883.term-definition: reference - Information that adds sources, interpretations, and other important industry-based context to a concept. See authoritative reference.

f51547f7fe7d8bc922d8684d56a0c289.term-definition: reference linkbase - An optional XML file containing information to provide authoritative literature (references) for concepts.

696edabb8b2f669b03b07ae544da25fc.term-definition: regulatory or NGO requirements - The rules, mandates, or stipulations to which data represented by an XBRL must adhere. These types of requirements may come from governmental agencies, non-governmental organizations, industry groups, or internal oversight within the industry. They are often a large, driving force in determining the taxonomy's functional requirements, and preparers typically must be in compliance with these requirements when they prepare an XBRL report.
696edabb8b2f669b03b07ae544da25fc.term-name-lang: متطلبات الجهات الرقابية او المنظمات غير الحكومية

0c8593987c309e98904de16c7fb64766.term-definition: relational data - A data set that has one or more semantic relationships among its data points. XBRL is designed to represent relational data.

f47b5e92122c806e473f02e025490e49.term-definition: render or rendering - The processing of displaying a taxonomy or an instance document in a layout that facilitates readability and understanding of its contents. XBRL software is typically required for rendering.
f47b5e92122c806e473f02e025490e49.term-definition-lang: معالجة عرض المفردات او تقرير في نسق يسهل القراءة وفهم المحتويت. برامح معالجة XBRL في العادية مطلوب منها معالجة عرض.

e6f872fe21d1b094147ad960ab4e995c.term-definition: reporting entity - An entity reporting data (synonymous with entity).
e6f872fe21d1b094147ad960ab4e995c.term-name-lang: المؤسسة التي تبلغ بيانتها من خلال التقرير - مرادف لمؤسسة

dc467572c8fab06ca395f2a569427a41.term-definition: reporting system - A system that receives, validates, accepts, stores, and potentially distributes XBRL data. Reporting systems may be as simple as a single entity to another single entity transmission, or they may be as large and complex as a multiple entity repository.
dc467572c8fab06ca395f2a569427a41.term-definition-lang: النظام الذي يستقبل، ويتحقق، و يقبل ويخزن ويوزع البيانات بصيغة XBRL. نظام التقارير قد يكون بسيط كامؤسسة واحدة تقدم تقرير لمؤسسة واحدو او قد يكون ضخم ومعقد مثل نظام ايداع تقارير لعدة مؤسسات.

8fc5dea35824cd24fd600fdc379c8225.term-definition: requires-element - A definition relationship indicating the value of one concept is required should the value of the other concept in the pair be present.
8fc5dea35824cd24fd600fdc379c8225.term-definition-lang: علاقة تعريفية تشير لإلى ان قيمة مفهوم تكون إلزامية في حالة تواجد قيمة مفهوم اخر.

67e16f8a6fd7ae0c2565252a066843be.term-definition: root - The top node of a hierarchical tree. The root can appear only once in that tree.
67e16f8a6fd7ae0c2565252a066843be.term-definition-lang: العقدة في المستوى الاعلى من شجرة التسلسل الهرمي. تظهر عقدة الجزر مرة واحدة فقط في الشجرة.

1c1f56e66f40ff3d5c2a4675098fe3e3.term-definition: rule name - The name assigned to an XBRL formula rule.

d3b197954e6d794ef2ace38d83b7a8c1.term-definition: scaling - A process that automatically scales numeric data by a defined value.
d3b197954e6d794ef2ace38d83b7a8c1.term-definition-lang: عملية تقريب البيانات الرقمية بشكل آلي بقيمة محددة
d3b197954e6d794ef2ace38d83b7a8c1.translation-notes: تقريب إلى اقرب مليون او اقرب ألف كما يحدث في البيانات المالية لتسهيل قراءة الارقام الكبيرة.

82203af66cfdc6e18dbf8d1b92c86849.term-definition: scenario - An XBRL construct that allows for additional information to be associated with facts in an instance document. This information encompasses the reporting circumstances of that fact (for example, "actual" or "forecast" describe contextual reporting circumstances). The scenario of any fact can be left unspecified. Scenarios can only be used in XBRL as XML or Inline XBRL.
82203af66cfdc6e18dbf8d1b92c86849.term-definition-lang: هو نوع من عناصر XBRL تتيح ربط وتعريف الحقائق بمعلومات إضافية في التقرير. هذه المعلومات تكون وفقاً لحالة الحقيقة، على سبيل المثال يتيح السيناريو تعريف حقيقة على انها أرقام فعلية او تنبؤات. السيناريو ليس إلزاميا ويمكن تركه خالي.

25386718a9602f5dae1a585ba6f21a9b.term-definition: schema - An XML file that defines the elements, structure, and data types of another XML file. XBRL schemas only define the concepts and data types; linkbases contain the structural information and relationships among the concepts. Schema files end with a ".xsd" file extension. A schema file can include and/or reference multiple other schema and linkbase files.
25386718a9602f5dae1a585ba6f21a9b.term-definition-lang: ملف ْXML الذي يتم فيه تعريف العناصر والهياكل وانواع البيانات الموجودة في ملف XML اخر. مخططات XBRL تعرف فقط المفاهيم وانواع البيانات؛ في حين قواعد الربط تحتوي على المعلومات الخاصة بالهيكل والعلاقات بين المفاهيم, ملفات المخطط تنتهي بإمتداد .xsd. ملف المخطط يمكن ان يحتوي و/أو يشير إلى ملفات مخططات أخرى وقواعد ربط.

49c5aa548c1506f080725b6f42663bd7.term-definition: segment - An XBRL construct that allows additional information to be included in the context of an instance document. This information captures information such as an entity's business units, type of debt, type of other income, and so forth. The scenario of any fact can be left unspecified. Scenarios can only be used in XBRL as XML or Inline XBRL.
49c5aa548c1506f080725b6f42663bd7.term-definition-lang: عنصر XBRL يتيح إضافة معلومات إلى المضمون. تتيح هذه المعلومات الإضافية الربط بقطاع او نوع دين او نوع إيراد.
49c5aa548c1506f080725b6f42663bd7.translation-notes: طريقة لتصنيف البيانات وربط القيمة بالابعاد المعرفة في المفردات.

ea106f39b925c18757f1e2dfbaa19f11.term-definition: semantic data model - A model that structures data in a specific, logical way. A semantic data model adds basic semantic and/or qualitative meaning to data points and the relationships that lie between them.
ea106f39b925c18757f1e2dfbaa19f11.term-definition-lang: نموذج يوفر هيكل للبيانات بشكل منطقي محدد. يضيف النموذج الدلالات الاساسية و/أو معنى نوعي لنقاط البيانات والعلاقات التي تربط بين تلك النقاط.

40a414eadff35a03c1b8a79f927c4d0a.term-definition: semantic interoperability - A data structure that is interpreted by the receiving system with all the meaning required to interpret that data, regardless of the originating system, time of interpretation, or the method of transmission. Semantic interoperability is achieved through adding information that links each data element to a well-defined, shared vocabulary among the systems.
40a414eadff35a03c1b8a79f927c4d0a.term-definition-lang: هيكل بيانات يتم ترجمته من النظام المستقبل بكل المعاني المطلوبة لترجمة البيانات بغض النظر عن نوعية التظام المرسل،وقت ترجمة البيانات، او طريقة الإرسال. التوافقية الدلالية يمكن تحقيقها من خلال إضافة معلومات تربط عناصر البيانات لفردات جيدة التصميم يتم مشاركتها بين الانظمة (المرسلة والمستقبلة).
40a414eadff35a03c1b8a79f927c4d0a.translation-notes: اي نظم يمكنه التعامل مع البيانات واخراج نفس النتائج اي كان نوع النظام المصدر للبيانات او المستقبل لها.

dc050d969444cdb6909f3dcba072aa4e.term-definition: sibling relationship - A relationship between concepts that indicates two or more nodes in a hierarchical structure have the same parent node (are located at the same level in hierarchy).
dc050d969444cdb6909f3dcba072aa4e.term-definition-lang: علاقة بين مفاهيم تشير إلى ان عقدتين او اكثر في التسلسل الهرمي لهم نفس الاصل المباشر (موجودين على نفس المستوى من التسلسل الهرمي).

1a2c339304320a65d15d281ea294d6ae.term-definition: similar-tuples - A definition relationship that is operationally the same as the essence-alias definition but reserved for usage with tuples. Tuples are not commonly used.
1a2c339304320a65d15d281ea294d6ae.term-definition-lang: علاقة مثل علاقة essence-alias التعريفية لكنها تستخدم فقط مع عناصر المجموعات. في العادة لا يتم استخدام عناصر المجموعات بكثرى.

ca05cad2e3062411fa968597a6e9fbe3.term-definition: simple data type - An XML construct constrains the textual values that may appear within an element or as a value for an attribute. Simple data types can either be primitive or derived.

354bdf6e4991eac129dcc8d0d047ba51.term-definition: simple link - A link type in XLink that creates a unidirectional hyperlink from one element to another through a URI.
354bdf6e4991eac129dcc8d0d047ba51.term-definition-lang: نوع من روابك XLink ينشئ رابط بإتجاه واحد من عنصر إلى اخر عن طريق URI.

85152224d6c5c7159d05152b7ec3c29e.term-definition: specification - An industry-developed set of precise precepts and instructions for creating a technical document. XBRL has multiple specifications that underlie and define its usage, include the XBRL Specification, the XBRL Dimensions Specification, and the XBRL Open Information Model.
85152224d6c5c7159d05152b7ec3c29e.term-definition-lang: مجموعة من الضوابط والتعليمات الدقيقة للوثائق التقنية. XBRL لديه مواصفات متعددةالتي تؤسس وتحدد طريقة استخدامه و تتضمن مواصفات XBRL و موصفات الابعاد و موصفات نموذج البيانات المفتوح.

0a9023f8de7218e4e775c3e3593d82e8.term-definition: stakeholder - An entity with interest or concern in a project. A stakeholder may be comprised of a single person, a group of people, or an entire organization. In XBRL taxonomy development, stakeholders typically offer opinions, insight, and experience concerning the nature of the data to be reported and how that reporting process should operate.

c959082624924a4a290b80476af342a7.term-definition: standard label - The default label for a concept. An extension may override the standard label.
c959082624924a4a290b80476af342a7.term-definition-lang: المسمى المفترض للمفهوم. يمكن للمفردات الإضافية تغير المسمى المعياري.

50559c9523ca12ce29aff270df6cf629.term-definition: substitution group property - A property of a concept categorizing that concept as one of a number of types, such as item, dimension, or hypercube.
50559c9523ca12ce29aff270df6cf629.term-definition-lang: خاصية تصف المفهوم في نوع محدد من انواع متعددة، على سبيل المثال عنصر، بُعد او مكعب متعدد الابعاد.

5b7fc0605a3e74d2b0ebbc350324469c.term-definition: suffix - An ending to a concept name that specifies that concept's role in the taxonomy ("Axis," "Table," or "Member", for example). Abstract concepts are often named with a suffix.
5b7fc0605a3e74d2b0ebbc350324469c.term-definition-lang: نهاية اسم المفهوم والتي تحدد دور المفهوم في المفردات على سبيل المثال محور، جدول، عضو نطاق. المفاهيم المجردية يتم تسميتها بلاحقة في العادة.
5b7fc0605a3e74d2b0ebbc350324469c.translation-notes: كلمة او رمز تضاف في اخر الاسم لدلالة معينة.

75cb9e98d5fda08e953cf75f725f4c3f.term-definition: support and maintenance phase - The stage of the taxonomy lifecycle during which the taxonomy is regularly updated to reflect new or altered regulatory requirements, technological updates, or other changes. Changes must be disseminated to the reporting environment.

11599020258fe8f82137b40ef2580f7f.term-definition: syntactic interoperability - A common syntax by which two or more systems communicate with each other. XBRL provides for syntactic interoperability through a syntactical specification that relies on XML and a means of providing an ontology (an XBRL taxonomy) to identify the meaning of that information within a well-defined semantic framework.
11599020258fe8f82137b40ef2580f7f.term-definition-lang: اسلوب تعبيري مشترك بين نظامين او اكثر تتصل ببعضها. يوفر XBRL التوافقية التعبيرية من خلال مواصفات تعبيرية تعتمد على XML وتوفير دلالات المفردات (مفردات XBRL) لتحديد معاني المعلومات من خلال إطار دلالات جيد التصميم.

8fa4db42ca972a05daabc23c5b8d0524.term-definition: table - A method of organizing relational data along a set of dimensions (columns) and a set of line items (rows). In XBRL, each fact of one of the line items can be further characterized along one or more of its dimensions.
8fa4db42ca972a05daabc23c5b8d0524.term-definition-lang: طريقة لترتيب البيانات المرتبطة على ابعاد (اعمدة) وبنود (صفوف). في XBRL كل حقيقة في بند يمكن وصفها عن طريق بُعج او أكثر.

aeebfa3c815a438974bdd307ef981721.term-definition: tag - Markup information that describes an XBRL fact in an instance document expressed in XML or Inline XBRL. Angle brackets ("<>" and "</>") enclose tags around XBRL facts.

1f27e9e3c6cca3877f8316e70b500d6b.term-definition: taxonomy - An electronic library of XBRL concepts used to report data, describing both those concepts' semantic meanings and their relationships with each other. A taxonomy is composed of a schema file (.xsd) and linkbase files (.xml) directly referenced by that schema. An XBRL taxonomy can be considered a transport data model or the structured model by which information is transferred from a source business model to a data consumer model.
1f27e9e3c6cca3877f8316e70b500d6b.term-definition-lang: مكتبة الكترونية لمفاهيم XBRL المستخدمة في التقارير، تصف كلا من الدلالة للمفهوم وعلاقته بالمفاهيم الاخرى. تتكون المفردات من ملف مخطط (.xsd) وملفات قواعد الربط (.xml) مشار إليه مباشرة من المخطط. تعتبر المفردات نموذج نقل بيانات او النموذج المهيكل الذي يتم عن طريقه نقل البيانات من المصدر إلى مستهلك البيانات.

510096da56e60bd5decab2bb1fb0ea07.term-definition: taxonomy committee - A combination governance structure of the taxonomy steering committee and the taxonomy working group. This setup is well suited for the support and maintenance phase of taxonomy development or for taxonomies that are smaller in size and scope.

98c1b13f7612acfba16ac0a0bd77686c.term-definition: taxonomy-defined dimension - An optional XBRL dimension that expresses additional contextual and semantic information about a fact. Taxonomy-defined dimensions are comprised of abstract concepts and can be either explicit or typed. Taxonomy-defined dimensions are defined with a combination of the taxonomy schema file and one or more linkbase files.
98c1b13f7612acfba16ac0a0bd77686c.term-definition-lang: بُعد اختياري يعبر عن معلومات إضافية للمضمون والدلالات للحقيقة. وتتكون تلك الابعاد من مفاهيم مجردة ويمكن ان تكون محددة بعينها او محددة النوعية. يتم تعريف تلك الابعاد عن طريق مخطط المفردات وقواعد الربط.

562306ac0e982d419b922658dbc742bc.term-definition: Taxonomy Guide - A document explaining the nature of the XBRL taxonomy, including the design decisions that went into its creation, to an audience of developers. The Taxonomy Guide should contain an in-depth discussion of the taxonomy itself, its structure, validation methods, and other relevant information that aids developers in understanding how the taxonomy functions as a data transport model.

a1390ff3a8eaac1285b6092805a0840e.term-definition: taxonomy navigation - The act of using XULE to traverse the hierarchical structure of a taxonomy and return a set of concepts along a defined path.

88566fa3c8cd15df9d502d2905361b83.term-definition: taxonomy manager - The individual(s) functioning as a point of contact for all stages of the taxonomy lifecycle. The taxonomy manager maintains detailed knowledge of the taxonomy and the project as a whole and provides day-to-day staff support for the taxonomy working group, as well as receiving and reviewing comments, overseeing and testing changes, and coordinating with regulators or other stakeholders.

4a8ed75764f0cb65da28aeaece8239f5.term-definition: taxonomy sponsor - The individual, group, or organization championing the development of the XBRL taxonomy. For large taxonomies with a wide impact on the information supply chain, a regulator, standards organization, or non-profit industry body may act as sponsor to successfully bring together stakeholders. For small taxonomies, the sponsor may be internal to a company.

e8dd74f6b090df318f7dbc224addb125.term-definition: taxonomy steering committee - The group overseeing the development of the taxonomy during the build and pilot phases. This group can be comprised of technical and subject matter experts, and it can evaluate the major milestones, reviews and approves taxonomy deliverables, and serve as a "tie breaker" on major decisions. A taxonomy steering committee is often applicable to a large taxonomy development project.

43993f99211b111f55f62f9640bfba22.term-definition: taxonomy working group - The group conducting and implementing the development of the taxonomy during the build, pilot, and implementation phases. This group may include preparers, data intermediaries, and data consumers, as well as software and database providers and taxonomy developers. Regulators, legislators, and industry experts can serve as observers to ensure legislative requirements and regulatory goals are correctly implemented.

ec8c4d05b5481ef68e8038089fafb499.term-definition: terse label - A label that contains a short description for a concept.

6c2d1c540fc2753530c8ecdd59ce89e3.term-definition: test expression - The portion of an XBRL formula that contains the logical statement that will be evaluated.

f4194bd5b7377bf2a093480c86848631.term-definition: total label - A label to indicate a concept represents a sum of a set of fact values associated with other concepts.

d54a0cd45c61f911069cd24edd16ca95.term-definition: transformation - An Inline XBRL construct that describes how the descriptive language can be converted to an appropriate XBRL format. For more information, see the XBRL Transformation Registry.

fef83cae98ad8b50df2f9111ea4e311a.term-definition: transport data model - A semantic data model intended to organize and transport data from a business data model to a consumer data model. An XBRL taxonomy, which is highly structured and standardized, serves as a machine-readable transport model.
fef83cae98ad8b50df2f9111ea4e311a.term-definition-lang: نموذج بيانات دلالي يهجف لتنظيمونقل البيانات من نموذج بيانات الاعمال إلى نموذج بيانات المستهلك. مفردات XBRL وهي مهيكلة ومعيارية هي نموذج نقر يمكن قرائته بشكل آلي.

e3c7cbf1e658198baa39dc08c62006db.term-definition: transport format - The format in which XBRL data is transmitted from preparers to consumers. The transport format, which may be XBRL in XML, JSON, CSV, or Inline XBRL, stipulates the syntactic structure of the XBRL report. XBRL taxonomy documents (schema and linkbase files) are always formatted in XML.

05b692df9aa02a04f5a4d2b00804db9f.term-definition: tree - The common name for the visual display of a hierarchy, with a root node, branching nodes, and further child nodes.
05b692df9aa02a04f5a4d2b00804db9f.term-definition-lang: الاسم المعتاد لطريقة عرض التسلسل الهرمي، له عقدة جزر وعقد افرع وعقد تابعة.

29f435ba6108d6bb27e3f553b9857d0f.term-definition: tuple - A method of expressing an XBRL fact such that the fact is comprised of two or more data point pairs. Tuples are rarely used in XBRL taxonomies.
29f435ba6108d6bb27e3f553b9857d0f.term-definition-lang: طريقة للتعبير عن حقيقة XBRL بحيث تكون الحقيقة مكونة من اكثرة من نقطة بيانات واحدة. يندر إستخدام عنصر المجموعة في مفردات XBRL.

cfd5039fc0d4830f028af6f1c98f48ba.term-definition: typed taxonomy-defined dimension - A taxonomy-defined dimension whose domain of allowable values is determined by the data type of its domain concept. This data type can be loose or tightly constrained, and it can contain an enumeration of allowable values.
cfd5039fc0d4830f028af6f1c98f48ba.term-name-lang: بُعد مُعرف في المفردات محدد النوعية
cfd5039fc0d4830f028af6f1c98f48ba.term-definition-lang: هو بُعد يتكون نطاقه من قيم مسموح بها اذا كانت من نوع بيانات معين. يمكن ان يكون نوع البيانات محدد بشكل صارم او بشكل متسع ويمكن ان تتكون من قائمة بالقيم المسموح بها.

fe6113438459429a6b42d2bc65afa823.term-definition: unit - The units in which numeric items have been measured, such as dollars, watts, pounds, or Euros per share.

46273784a57fc025c407e1ac84a579b2.term-definition: unit core dimension - An optional XBRL dimension that expresses the units of a fact. The unit core dimension is only applicable to numeric facts.

1ce36200ee46ac8cf770f28ba8773d30.term-definition: usable property - A property of a domain value that means this value is permissible in a hypercube.
1ce36200ee46ac8cf770f28ba8773d30.term-definition-lang: خاصية نطاق تشير إلى انه يمكن استخدام ذلك النطاق في المكعب متعدد الابعاد.

b4a8fa95b97de04c6592f9227fd774b1.term-definition: use case - A type of requirements specification for a system that represents a list of actions or steps that defines interactions between users and the system to achieve a specific goal.
b4a8fa95b97de04c6592f9227fd774b1.term-definition-lang: نوعية من المتطلبات للأنظمة تمثل قائمو من الافعال او الخطوات التفاعل بين المستخدم و النظام لتحقيق هدف محدد.

0f96447ddb1c7cedd40dd2a1be222160.term-definition: UTF-8 - A method of encoding Unicode characters. UTF-8 is a variable width character encoding capable of encoding all 1,112,064 valid code points in Unicode using one to four 8-bit bytes. XML is typically encoded in UTF-8. See encoding.

aba37ce8586132e6787bae96fef687ed.term-definition: validation - The process of checking that instance documents and taxonomies correctly meet the rules of the XBRL specification, any regulatory requirements, or other requirements set forth by the taxonomy developers.
aba37ce8586132e6787bae96fef687ed.term-definition-lang: عملية التأكد من ان التقرير والمفردات تتوافق بشكل صحيح مع قواعد مواصفات XBRL، والمتطلبات الرقابية ومتطلبات اخرى يتم تحديدها من قِبل مطوري المفردات.

cd6dd7de425895273bdaed5ff8fe86a3.term-definition: variables - The input data for an XBRL formula test expression. Variable are defined with the '$' character and a name. Variables typically contain fact data from an XBRL report which is evaluated in the test expression to determine if that data passes a logical condition.

b7db3af20a13d88e7c1e021fee8c7c69.term-definition: verbose label - A label that contains a longer description of a concept.

cf2943b83bcdc050f720efc23ebfd4d4.term-definition: weight - A calculation relationship attribute (-1 or +1) that works in conjunction with parent and child numeric concepts to determine the arithmetic summation relationship between them.
cf2943b83bcdc050f720efc23ebfd4d4.term-definition-lang: سمة من سمات العلاقة الحسابية تكون قيمتها (-1 أو +1) تحدد العلاقة الجمع الحسابي بالاشتراك مع المفاهيم الرقمية للاصل والفرع

b27254bdeb3f9f3b94cc9498b9b4b628.term-definition: white paper - A short document that concisely presents an industry problem, the pertinent regulations, requirements, and use cases relevant to the problem, the options considered, and an XBRL taxonomy as a solution.
b27254bdeb3f9f3b94cc9498b9b4b628.term-definition-lang: مذكرة قصيرة تصف بدقة المشكلة والقواعد والمتطلبات وطرق الاستخدام المتعلقة بالمشكلة والخيارات المؤخوذة في الاعتبار و الحل عن طريق مفردات XBRL.

859f12ed11849e239240329036823dd9.term-definition: workflow - The sequence of development, administrative, validation, implementation, or other processes through which a piece of work passes from initiation to completion.

1475c08e6b738f708f4d1e5c8ed31fdc.term-definition: XBRL - Extensible Business Reporting Language, or an XML-based standard for electronic communication of financial and business data that provides for both machine and human-readability.
1475c08e6b738f708f4d1e5c8ed31fdc.term-definition-lang: معيار يعتمد على XML لنقل البيانات المالية وبيانات الاعمال وتوفر صيغة قابلة للقراءة بشرياً وآلياً.

5209614e6e53404e0429f109c3119c4d.term-definition:
XBRL dimension - An XBRL construct that serves to add semantic information to a fact. XBRL dimensions also uniquely identify a fact. An XBRL dimension may either be one of the core dimensions listed below or a taxonomy-defined dimension.
Concept Core Dimension*	Period Core Dimension*	Entity Core Dimension*
Language Core Dimension	Unit Core Dimension	Note ID Core Dimension
Taxonomy-Defined Dimension
Items marked with an asterisk (*) are required on any given fact.

2cf32228823a7c5eba630ff9b58f35b6.term-definition: XBRL report or instance document - A file that contains business reporting information using one or more XBRL taxonomies. The XBRL report (or instance document) represents a collection of facts and report-specific information.

121c1db45d0f78df7badd291da876929.term-definition: XBRL Units Registry - A set of standard units for use in XBRL as defined by XBRL International. Numeric facts in XBRL should be intersected by an appropriate unit core dimension.

f0bc97e5be3e0d1eb84059d09e1a977c.term-definition: XLink - A specification that defines methods of specifying internal and external links within XML documents. XLink indicates the manner in which XML linkbase documents should be structured to provide the necessary linking and relationship information for the schema.

a9a12846b12a4ffd27d4761e2370b706.term-definition: XML - Extensible Markup Language, which is used to describe and define data by allowing users to define their own elements (in contrast to HTML where the tags are predefined). XBRL is an XML-based standard.
a9a12846b12a4ffd27d4761e2370b706.term-name-lang: اسم اللغة التي يعتمد عليها XBRL

ca8a337c4446497211a48975404af54f.term-definition: XML Schema Definition (XSD) - The format in which schema documents must be structured when describing the elements of that schema. The XSD format specifies information such as element declarations, attribute declarations, and property definitions for concepts.

39fc6e149076e6f28fcc2b6c914977c8.term-definition: zero label - A label to indicate a concept's fact value must be reported and interpreted as zero.

419d3736ce543528dbcec0d4a036c0d2.term-definition: zero-to-many relationship - A data dimension where one data point can exist with or without many other data points.

f162e6bde2b84e77f16a73e36b755e0c.term-definition: zero-to-one relationship - A data dimension where one data point can exist with or without the other data point of a pair.

a0fc3e49295a16775f21b508cda09448.term-definition: A taxonomy that is used as the starting point for an extension taxonomy.
a0fc3e49295a16775f21b508cda09448.term-definition-lang: المفردات المستخدمة كنقطة بداية لمفردات إضافية.

03bd44164db8be37c7fec2c692631275.term-definition: A single fact that contains the content of an entire section of a report. Ablock tag may include text, numeric values, tables and other data. A block tagprovides the contents of the section as a single fact, rather than tagging eachitem contained within it as separate facts. A block tag is a type of text block that allows for less granular reporting.
03bd44164db8be37c7fec2c692631275.term-definition-lang: حقيقة واحدة نحتوي على جزء كامل من التقرير. يمكن انتشمل نصوص وارقام وجداول وبيانات اخرى. توفر محتويات كحقيقة واحدة بدل من تعليم كل عنصر بشكل منفرد كحقيقة منفصلة. وهو اسلوب يسمح بتقرير اقل تفصيلاً.

5b429853d6a498048266029ad69f1dfa.term-definition: Dimensions that are defined by the XBRL specification, and which are required for all facts (depending on their datatype). For example, the "period" built-in dimension defines the date or period in time to which a fact relates, and the "unit" built-in dimension defines the units, such as a monetary currency, in which a numeric fact is reported. Taxonomies may add additional dimensions, referred to as taxonomy-defined dimensions [technical term: "core dimension"].
5b429853d6a498048266029ad69f1dfa.translation-notes: بُعد جوهري كما يطلق عليه في TDH.

a2e6bd2b4c40ee04aed82a3125093326.term-definition: Any document that is used to convey information in order to satisfy a specific reporting requirement. Business reports are typically periodic in nature and can include company annual reports, risk reports, tax reports and internal enterprise performance reports. Business reports may include tabular data, descriptive text, individual numeric facts, charts, graphs, or any combination of the above.

953a5fac85aadb8e973ff2bb89b2e2fd.term-definition: Validation rules that are backed by requirements from the underlyingbusiness domain. Examples of business validation rules include checking thatan appropriate currency has been used for monetary facts, checking thatmandatory facts have been reported, and checking that numeric values passappropriate calculation checks. Business validation rules may be included in ataxonomy as XBRL formula rules, enabling XBRL software to automatically checkthe quality of an XBRL report. These are included to improve data quality in areporting programme.

8732d52ab105cd04c300d5f90ccde468.term-definition: Relationships between concepts in a taxonomy for the purpose of describing and validating simple totals and subtotals. [At a technical level, these relationships are defined using the summation-item arcrole in the XBRL specification]

ebcf30f41975c765cb7d108221a9e98f.term-definition: A reporting programme in which the set of data points that isto be reported is prescribed completely by the collector of the reports. Theprocess to be followed by a preparer in a closed reporting programme is analogous tocompleting a paper form, as the boxes that may be completed are prescribedcompletely by the creator of the form (although as with paper forms, closed reportingprogrammes may include specific points of flexibility, such as where rows in a table may be repeated as many times as required).

c97f6f0f2cbddd93234764cc62e71083.term-definition: A person or organisation that receives or retrieves XBRL reports for the purpose of collecting and/or analysing the data within them. Collectors may include (but are not limited to) regulators and other government agencies, stock exchanges collecting financials from listed companies, banks collecting credit risk reports, and companies collecting financial data for consolidation.

297ec0908de89039282a35c613d731a0.term-definition: A taxonomy element that provides the meaning for a fact. For example, "Profit", "Turnover", and "Assets" would be typical concepts. [approximate technical term: concept (XBRL v2.1) or primary item (XBRL Dimensions). Concept, as defined here, excludes header and structural element. The term "Line Item" will sometimes be used to refer to a concept.]

72e3db1f54b83d8e36f7476b4f18a88b.term-definition: Final end users of the information collected in XBRL reports.

232f135dd8088bf81dcebd2929415096.term-definition: A multi-dimensional definition of related data synonymous with a business intelligence or data warehousing "cube". A cube is defined by combining a set of dimensions with a set of concepts. Cubes are often referred to as "hypercubes", as unlike a physical, 3-dimensional cube, a hypercube may have any number of dimensions. [Approximate technical term: "hypercube". Cube here is used to mean the combination of hypercubes in a single base set]

8df83106c6e98d30dba2990d48bcc325.term-definition: Definition of an item that can be reported in an XBRL report. In technical terms, this is the combination a concept and a number of dimension values. A value may be reported against a data point to give a fact.

edcdaf6483826175d1dd10e8d0582465.term-definition: A taxonomy that defines a dictionary of elements that is available for use in Unresolved reference 'reporting taxonomies', and which is not meant to be referenced directly by an XBRL report.For example, an accounting standard setter may provide a definitional taxonomy containing all concepts, and separate Unresolved reference 'reporting taxonomies' for different industries or company types.

e3c719381c5706519881497a2f3c4335.term-definition: The definition of cubes within a taxonomy.
e3c719381c5706519881497a2f3c4335.term-definition-lang: تعريف مكعبات متعددة الابعاد داخل المفردات

e553cf4379a3e052136b44ee463bab88.term-definition: A qualifying characteristic that is used to uniquely define a data point. For example, a fact reporting revenue may be qualified by a "geography" dimension, to indicate the region to which the revenue relates. A dimension may be either a taxonomy-defined dimension or a built-in dimension. [Technical term: "Aspect"]

dafac29a22b6cbb91a1383b873dbe501.term-definition: A value taken by a particular dimension when defining a data point. For example, the dimension value for the period built-in dimension would be a specific date or date range, the dimension value for an explicit taxonomy-defined dimension is a domain member and the dimension value for a typed taxonomy-defined dimension is a value that is valid against the format that has been specified in the taxonomy.

103b82f36befa18e243985b68e4c789d.term-definition: A domain is a set of related values. Examples of different domains for use on a "geography" dimension would be "Countries", "Continents" or "States".In XBRL, domains are defined using taxonomy elements that are used to group domain members.

c05ac16f1a3bdecf7a9933dba44b1c38.term-definition: An element representing one of the possibilities within a domain. These may be used as possible values for explicit taxonomy-defined dimensions or enumerations.

40f4393f41e75ae18669b7eb2d3e47c3.term-definition: Disclosures included in a report that are specific to the reporting entity, or to a small number of reporting entities. Such disclosures require special handling in XBRL as it is not practical for the base taxonomy to include the concepts and domain members needed to report all such disclosures for all entities. In order to facilitate the tagging of such disclosures, mechanisms such as Unresolved reference 'entity-specific extension taxonomies' may be used. Entity-specific disclosures are common in open reporting environments, but do not occur in closed reporting environments.

92aeb0259faba566a16b21452a7a9b1b.term-definition: An extension taxonomy that is created by the preparer of an XBRL report in order to disclose information that is specific to the reporting entity (see entity-specific disclosure).

753cf6f98e0dc93a013d9b669be3d4f7.term-definition: Enumerations are a taxonomy-defined ordered list of values for a fact. When a concept is defined to be an enumeration type, then the preparer can only report value(s) from this list. For more information, see the enumerations in XBRL guidance.

8b2c5cc223e2e5f799016d4d3acfc020.term-definition: A taxonomy that is constructed using one or more other taxonomies (a base taxonomy) as a starting point. Extension taxonomies are typically created by a different entity from the author of the base taxonomy. Extension taxonomies may be created by preparers (see entity-specific extension taxonomy) , or they may be created by a collector making use of a taxonomy from a third party such as an accounting standards body.

8d4aaa3164bbf672ae6938bbfa7b1908.term-definition: A fact is an individual piece of information in an XBRL report. A fact is represented by reporting a value against a concept (e.g., profit, assets), and associating it with a number of dimension values (e.g., units, entity, period, other dimensions) that together uniquely define a data point.

6cf08b3c24c61aa6bcd2823471e7ec12.term-definition: The file or set of files that is submitted to a collector. This will include an XBRL report and may include additional files such as an extension taxonomy.

a3ac28495d19f02f5c9b507e73929fd2.term-definition: These are additional instructions and material usually provided inconjunction with filing rules, giving guidance that helps preparers tocreate filings correctly. For example, this might include guidance on selectingconcepts or the scope of the tagging that should be applied. In general,the application of filing guidance cannot be automatically validated, and needsthe judgement of the preparer to apply.

45865312a6d1811454d2364b34d51d13.term-definition: Validation rules that are driven by the technical requirements of the reporting programme in order to ensure interoperability. Examples of filing rules include specifying which versions and modules of the XBRL specifications may be used in filings, any applicable file size limits, restrictions on if and how extension taxonomies should be constructed. Filing rules will usually be enforced by the collector's submission system.

8e98d091a46acfcd5217fe24ea389f67.term-definition: Taxonomy elements that are used to provide headings and guidance in a concept hierarchy, such as the presentation tree. It is not possible toreport a fact using a header element. [approximate technical term: "abstract element"]

b6844364c9bddcd213ebedb0df710f49.term-definition: See iXBRL report. The terms Inline XBRL and iXBRL are used interchangeably.

71ae1a0ef3b6d131ace9cb0857e461b4.term-definition: A single document that combines structured, computer-readable data with the preparer's presentation using the iXBRL (or Inline XBRL) standard. An iXBRL report provides the same XBRL data as an XBRL report, but embeds it into an HTML document that can be viewed in a web browser. By linking structured data and human-readable presentation into a single document, iXBRL provides the benefits of computer-readable structured data whilst enabling preparers to retain full control over the presentation of their reports.

93217fc7304efd834980d538a5f06830.term-definition: A human readable description of a taxonomy component. XBRL labels can be defined in multiple languages and can be of multiple types, such as a "standard label", which provides a concise name for the component, or a "documentation label" which provides a more complete definition of the component.

651306f301e614c91e9ec1cef293567e.term-definition: An environment where a preparer must make their own decisions about exactly which data points are to be reported. This is commonly found in financial reporting where the reporting requirements are expressed as a set of principles that must be followed, rather than a specific set of data points that must be reported. Open reporting environments may allow preparers to provide an extension taxonomy that defines any additional data points needed, although there are other approaches to implementing open reporting with XBRL.

eff5bb86ac87be27498e263b15d7aa4d.term-definition: Non-automatable rules are those which are mandatory but which cannot reasonably be enforced automatically. These would typically be checked using a manual or semi-automated process. An example of a non-automatable rule is, "A calculation tree must be defined if the preparer's presentation shows two or more line items along with their net or total."

2058c986c6c15065aa9fe21eb7ae9911.term-definition: A person or organisation that creates XBRL reports or iXBRL reports.

d63da2bde49199d8f8604e8e12348844.term-definition: The human-readable presentation of a business report. The term is usedto refer to the report as it would be presented on paper, PDF or HTML.This term is of particular relevance in open reporting environments, wherepreparers typically have significant control over the layout andpresentation of a report. An iXBRL report embeds XBRL data into an HTMLdocument, allowing a single document to provide both the preparer'spresentation and structured data from an XBRL report.

9896c2f8c3c4a69148d3a40ddfd8d851.term-definition: The organisation of taxonomy elements into a hierarchical structure with the aim of providing a means of visualising or navigating the taxonomy. [At a technical level, the presentation tree is defined using the parent-child arcrole in the XBRL specification]

f04034b3420ae8ed6adff83700f6f031.term-definition: A piece of structured information attached to a taxonomy component that provides a link to external information about the element. References are typically used to provide links to the definition of a taxonomy component in authoritative literature, such as the relevant accounting standard or legislation. A taxonomy component may have any number of references associated with it. Each reference is composed of a number of reference parts.

3af5962462a812d15f4520c2127c6fb9.term-definition: An individual component of a reference, for example "Chapter 4", or "Paragraph 3". The XBRL standard provides a number of standard reference part types, such as "Article", "Chapter" and "Section". If necessary, taxonomies can define additional reference part types.

366a6b5a3cd868495fa4e123433002b9.term-definition: A taxonomy used to define the contents of an XBRL report and against which reports are validated. Intended to be used directly by an XBRL report. See also, definitional taxonomy.

65e7ce0fce46001c0472a5666b165490.term-definition: Taxonomy elements that are technical constructs for cubes, dimensions, domain and domain members.

215dadfbd5664fb29487703b8758ac7a.term-definition: The process of creating an XBRL report through selection of XBRLconcepts, dimensions and other information and application to values inan existing business report in order to create facts. Tagging is onepossible approach to the creation of XBRL reports.

bbe242733b66e636078f3a165f010aa0.term-definition: A taxonomy links and defines a number of taxonomy components that provide the meaning for facts in an XBRL report. For example, a taxonomy for an accounting standard would include definitions of concepts such as "Profit", "Turnover", and "Assets". Taxonomies may contain a very rich set of information, including multi-language labels, links (known as references) to authoritative definitions (for example, accounting standards or relevant local laws), validation rules and other relationships. Physically, a taxonomy is usually stored in a set of files hosted on a website.

7fe338a1d91ced77c5064b8a92975ede.term-definition: A person responsible for making design decisions that are applied across a taxonomy.

b747f89930cca8140c399e001661acc9.term-definition: A person or organisation who is responsible for defining the content of a taxonomy.

e087e5e4925716ef73845c6dd70ef0d7.term-definition: A person or organisation who is responsible for maintaining taxonomy content and taxonomy design/structure. A taxonomy owner may also be a collector, or may be a third party such as an accounting standards body.

493cb34fcfb90a1cbaff8effc104de6a.term-definition: Anything that can be defined in a taxonomy.

e37d164b921d05446b6ebea6d00647da.term-definition: A dimension that is defined by a taxonomy, as opposed to a built-in dimension. This can be defined to provide any additional qualification needed to fully identify a fact. For example, a taxonomy-defined dimension could be used to indicate that a fact relates to a specific geographic region. A taxonomy-defined dimension may be either "explicit", in which case the taxonomy defines a list of allowed dimension values (e.g. a list of countries), or "typed", in which case the taxonomy defines the format for dimension values (e.g. the format for a postal code).

0ac3cb50c98eda9483cea774c35cabb9.term-definition: A subset of taxonomy components which may be included in the standard tree structures, such as the presentation tree and calculation tree. This includes concepts, header and structural element. [Technical term: "concept definition", corresponding to an XML element declaration in the xbrli:item or xbrli:tuple substitution group]

a436cb4d5f9451ecdb6221df9036b245.term-definition: A taxonomy entry point identifies a subset (or "view") of a taxonomy. Taxonomies will often provide multiple views for different, related reporting purposes. For example, a taxonomy may cater for different industries reporting under the same accounting standard. A taxonomy entry point is identified by a unique URL (or set of URLs), and is what is referenced by an XBRL report or an extension taxonomy.

975db14b6a9b183bf0f8eb5a21eddbf9.term-definition: A text tag that contains narrative text. In some reporting programmes,text blocks may include markup such as tables. Where a text block is used asan alternative to more granular tagging, it is referred to as a block tag.

9b1d701a5376cb14f8b691d6f4a0ba18.term-definition: A fact that contains textual information. Text tags that contain narrativetext are sometimes referred to as text blocks.

2b22b93862f577dda9ee617c2578c3fa.term-definition: Rules that can be applied automatically to XBRL reports in order to ensure quality and interoperability. Validation rules can be either business validation rules or filing rules.

ad19fae5d23fc9ce057a35528acd4c43.term-definition: Family of specifications used for digital business reporting.

47569fadac7fc7f1d50a128ffd30b93e.term-definition: Validation rules defined in a taxonomy using the XBRL Formulaspecification. These are applied by XBRL processors in addition to XBRL validation [Technical term: XBRL Formula Assertion]

83b877a30cd5de3faf90c29fff33b46b.term-definition: A business report prepared using the XBRL standard. An XBRL report isthe file that contains the data that is to be reported in an XBRL filingprogramme. A report refers to a specific taxonomy entry point and it is thecombination of the XBRL report and the taxonomy that enables thecontents of a XBRL report to be fully understood. [Technical term: Instancedocument]

fc37eac15fe89e01b656e8ecc5f47622.term-definition: A tabular view of a taxonomy or report that is used for presentation or data entry purposes. XBRL reporting templates can support complex, multi-dimensional reports, such as those seen in prudential reporting, and provide a business user-friendly view of the data. XBRL reporting templates are typically used in closed reporting programmes, where a template is prescribed by the collector. [At a technical level, XBRL reporting templates are defined using the Table Linkbase specification]

25bac5676512ab797702623075fc3479.term-definition: Rules defined by the XBRL specifications that must be adhered to by all XBRL reports and Unresolved reference 'taxonomies'. The rules for XBRL reports ensure a base level of document validity, for example, ensuring that any concepts used in the XBRL report are defined by the corresponding taxonomy, ensuring that monetary concepts have numeric values and currency units, and that facts use combinations of dimensions that are valid according to the dimensional structure defined in the taxonomy. Additional validation rules can be defined in a taxonomy as XBRL formula rules.

f63736d57897e0a96c279c5c9e7ad34e.term-definition: Technical construct that defines relationships, for example, those used to create a presentation tree or calculation tree.

3619c3c90988e06f1fa6db3635891f5d.term-definition: A namespace is a globally unique identifier that differentiate names created by different sources. In XBRL usage, namespaces are used to disambiguate the taxonomy element names defined in taxonomies. For example, different regional accounting standards might define a concept called "Profit". Namespaces are used to differentiate the UK GAAP definition of "Profit" from the US GAAP definition of "Profit". Namespaces are URIs, which are identifiers that follow the same format as URLs, which are used to locate resources on the internet.

5cbf4d0d558fcdd0a73dc790db97341e.term-definition: Namespace prefixes are a shorthand notation to represent namespaces. When representing the name of taxonomy element, it is common to use a notation such as "ifrs-full:Profit". In this case "ifrs-full" is a shorthand for the "http://xbrl.ifrs.org/taxonomy/2016-03-31/ifrs-full" namespace. Namespace prefixes must be defined in the document in which they are used, and may be used to represent different namespaces in different documents.

b9b119fdc59f22a04c5dad9f15291d26.term-definition: The standard distribution format for a taxonomy. For more information, see the taxonomy package practice profile.

fa61a1778b5a25bb39906f9211861eb3.term-definition: An attribute of an element to indicate that the element is only used in a hierarchy to group related elements together. An abstract element cannot be used to tag data in an instance document.

9290bb207ff19db753856fe1f3a5af1b.term-definition: A property of an element such as its name, balance, data type, and whether the element is abstract. Attributes of XBRL US GAAP Taxonomy elements cannot be changed.

3f98e0c93a2968c867667f81c07aaa5d.term-definition: Citations to specific authoritative accounting literature (pronouncements, standards, rules, and regulations) derived from various authoritative sources (Securities and Exchange Commission, Financial Accounting Standards Board, American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, etc.) and used to help define an element.

5f7d1b1e12ea5d38021879ae11f21659.term-definition: An instance document contains facts; an axis differentiates facts and each axis represents a way that the facts may be classified. For example, Revenue for a period might be reported along a business unit axis, a country axis, a product axis, and so forth.

5dccce0da8bfa795f34c38c208950839.term-definition: The dimensional relationship indicating that the table axis has a default domain member. In the XBRL US GAAP Taxonomies 1.0, the default is always the domain element.

01afd20c9c846385959648497a9549a0.term-definition: The dimensional relationship indicating that the table axis has members drawn from a domain.
